name: canadia hat
sizes_available: preemie, baby, toddler, child, tween, adult s, adult l
notes:
canadia hat was primarily designed as a chemo cap, but works equally well as a winter beanie. the lime green color of the original matches the support ribbon for those afflicted with lymphoma, a disease that a loved one of mine struggled against and overcame.

there is a free, ad-supported version of this crochet pattern available on my website here: https://bananamoonstudio.com/crochet-chemo-cap-pattern/

this description contains affiliate links. if you click one and then make a purchase, i will earn a small commission at no additional cost to you. see my [disclosure][1] for details.

difficulty level: intermediate

available sizes: preemie, baby, toddler, child, tween, adult s, adult l

finished measurements: hat circumference at widest point 10 ½, 14, 15 ¾, 17 ¾, 19 ½, 20, 21 ¼] inches; hat height 4 ¼, 6 ½, 7 ¾, 7 ¾, 8 ¾, 8 ¾, 9 ¾ inches.

yarn: [we crochet swish worsted][2] (100% fine superwash merino wool; 110 yds; 50 g; yarn weight category 4/medium/worsted): #25139 peapod

yardage: 45, 85, 110, 115, 140, 145, 180 yds

[crochet hook: i (5.5 mm)][3], or size needed to match gauge.

notions: [locking stitch marker][4], [tapestry needle][5], ½ button, sewing thread to match yarn, sewing needle, [pom pom][6].

gauge: 14 sts x 6 rows = 4 inches in alternating rows of linked treble st and double crochet.
